channel.title: Enviorment Variables Trouble
channel.description:
[b]I have recently changed the vars and now nothing is working (Cliets not servers) Can anyone Telle me the defaults.
I ahve JDK and JRE 6 update 13.
I need the Path and CLASSPATH defaults.
Or if not, how can I restore them ????
PLZ HELPPPPP!!!!! :|
Thanks [/b]
_________________________ EDIT:
I now arranged something but now it says: [i][b] 'JAVA' Is not recognized as an internal or external command, operatable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . . [/b][/i]
[u][i]WHAT AM I GONNA DO????[/i][/u]
This is what I wrote in the run batch file:
[b]@ECHO OFF TITLE WiltaScape Client v.3.0 (WiltaScape 4) and over color 0a JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI PAUSE[/b]

item.title: Enviorment Variables Trouble
item.dc:creator: @wiltabone wiltabone
item.description:
@wiltabone wrote:

Ty but now it says:

‘JAVA’ Is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operatable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . . [br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 15, 2009, 09:04:13 am[/size][hr]CAN ANYONE tell me wots the correct ones plz … I think Classpath is correct like this:
classpath: .;C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\lib\ext
BUT path aint gd

PLZZZZ tell me the correct one [br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 15, 2009, 09:55:30 am[/size][hr]OMFG CAN ANYONE SAY SOMETHInG!!! NOW IT’S BEEN LIKE 5 HRS

Read full topic

item.title: Enviorment Variables Trouble
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Just change your Path to C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\system32
and your classpath to C:\Program Files\Java\jre6

Read full topic

item.title: Enviorment Variables Trouble
item.dc:creator: @wiltabone wiltabone
item.description:
@wiltabone wrote:

[b]I have recently changed the vars and now nothing is working (Cliets not servers)
Can anyone Telle me the defaults.

I ahve JDK and JRE 6 update 13.

I need the Path and CLASSPATH defaults.

Or if not, how can I restore them ???

PLZ HELPPPPP!!!

Thanks [/b]

EDIT:

I now arranged something but now it says:

‘JAVA’ Is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operatable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . .

WHAT AM I GONNA DO???

This is what I wrote in the run batch file:

@ECHO OFF
TITLE WiltaScape Client v.3.0 (WiltaScape 4) and over
color 0a
JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI
PAUSE

Read full topic
